name: Nascar Double-Digit Victory Club Online Trivia | Sports | 15 Questions

questions.text: A native of Kentucky, I won 84 Cup races during my career. I was known as "Jaws" because of my penchant for gabbiness. Can you name me?
questions.explanation:
Darrell Waltrip.

	Waltrip was a charismatic driver and a reporter's delight. The highlight of his career came when he captured the 1989 Daytona 500, outlasting Ken Schrader and Dale Earnhardt.

questions.text: I made my Cup debut in November 1992, on the same date that Richard Petty made his last Cup start. Please identify me.
questions.explanation:
Jeff Gordon.

	Jeff Gordon and Richard Petty both participated in the Atlanta 500 race. Gordon finished in 31st place, and the King ended up in 39th position. Bill Elliott was the winner of that race.

questions.text: On April 27, 1952, I became the first driver to win 10 career Cup races. I would eventually win 48 Cup events.  Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Herb Thomas.

	Thomas won a 200-lap race in Macon, Georgia, to gain entry into the Double-Digit club. Tim Flock and his brother Fonty also reached the 10-victory milestone later during the 1952 season.

questions.text: My name is Harry Gant, and I won 18 Cup races between 1982 and 1992. At which track did I get the most wins?
questions.explanation:
Dover.

	"Handsome Harry" won four times at the Monster Mile in Dover. In one of those races, he lapped the entire field.

questions.text: I'm Bobby Allison, one of the all-time greats in Cup history. However, I never won a race at which of the following tracks?
questions.explanation:
Martinsville.

	Bobby Allison made 44 starts at Martinsville but never won a race at that track. He won 7 races at Richmond and 5 at Atlanta, however.

questions.text: I gained entry into the Double-Digit club in 2008, winning eight races that year. I became the first driver to win a Cup race in a Toyota. Please identify me.
questions.explanation:
Kyle Busch.

	Kyle Busch won his first 10 races at 10 different tracks, notching his first career victory at Fontana in 2005.

questions.text: My name is Cale Yarborough, and I won 83 Cup races during my career. In which state was I born?
questions.explanation:
South Carolina.

	Yarborough was born in Timmonsville in 1940. He won five Cup races in his native state.

questions.text: Hello, I won 21 Cup races during my career. In 1978, I won my 10th career race driving the number 72 Chevrolet at Dover. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Benny Parsons.

	Parsons was a popular driver in the 1970s and 1980s. After his retirement, he worked as a network TV commentator for many years.

questions.text: In 1958, I won the first Cup race ever held on Long Island. I won 21 races in my career, most of them in the number 47 Dodge. Can you name me?
questions.explanation:
Jack Smith.

	Smith won the inaugural race at Bridgehampton, a road course in eastern Long Island. His career spanned from 1949-1964.

questions.text: During my career I won 46 Cup races, including the inaugural event at Watkins Glen in 1957. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Buck Baker.

	Buck Baker's career spanned nearly 30 years, from 1949-1976. He won Cup races at 28 different tracks.

questions.text: Known as the 'Golden Boy' of racing, I won 26 Cup races between 1961 and 1967. Most of my victories occurred in the number 28 Ford. Please identify me.
questions.explanation:
Fred Lorenzen.

	Lorenzen was born in Illinois in 1934. He was a USAC champion for two seasons before he drove in NASCAR events.

questions.text: My name is Dale Jarrett, winner of 32 Cup events between 1991 and 2005. Where did I get my first victory?
questions.explanation:
Michigan.

	Dale Jarrett won his first race at the Michigan 400, edging out Davey Allison in an exciting finish. Dale's father Ned, won 50 races during his NASCAR career.

questions.text: Which of these drivers did not win 10 career Cup races?
questions.explanation:
Cotton Owens.

	Cotton Owens won nine Cup races between 1957 and 1964 in only 160 career starts. He also raced in the NASCAR modified series for several years. Panch had 17 victories, Turner won 17 races, and Baker took 19 checkered flags.

questions.text: I won 23 Cup races during a career that spanned from 1975-2007. In 1989, I won the first race ever held at Infineon Raceway in Sonoma. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Ricky Rudd.

	Ricky Rudd won at least one Cup race for 16 consecutive seasons ranging from 1983-1998. He was a versatile and strong-willed driver.

questions.text: My first name is Robert, but most people know me by my nickname. I won 50 Cup races during my career, including the 1958 North Wilkesboro 400 which put me into the Double-Digit club. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Junior Johnson.

	Robert Glen (Junior) Johnson is a legendary NASCAR driver and team owner. In addition to his 50 Cup victories as a driver, he won 139 races as a car owner with such drivers as Darrell Waltrip and Cale Yarborough.
